intro: Santaloides elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows on the branches of other trees. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers that are often inconspicuous. Its fruits are berries that contain seeds which are dispersed by birds. Santaloides elmeri plays a role in the ecological interactions of its host trees and contributes to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
